ORM is a terrible anti-pattern that violates all principles of OOP, tearing objects apart and turning them into passive data bags. #oop

SQL-Speaking Objects is, in my opinion, the best OOP alternative to ORM. #oop

Xembly is an XML building and manipulation language and a library. Please, add your GitHub star, help the project:
Tacit is a class-less CSS framework, for clueless programmers like me. Please, add your GitHub star, help the project:
Takes is a unique truly objet-oriented Java web framework. Please, add your GitHub star, help the project:
Rultor is a chatbot DevOps assistant to automate deployment and merge operations. Please, add your GitHub star, help the project:
Qulice is an aggregator of Java static analyzers. Please, add your GitHub star, help the project:
